marilib.aircraft_model.operations.mission_b module¶

Created on Thu Jan 24 23:22:21 2019

@author: DRUOT Thierry

This file contains specific mission function when the airplane is fully powered with batteries, thus, it does not change its mass along its flight. In function eval_e_nominal_mission, constraint_3 has been computed considering that the airplane takes the exact amount of batteries for the required range, eval_e_mission_coupling is written so far. Functions e_mission_payload, e_mission_tow, e_mission_range, e_mission_energy_limited and eval_cost_e_mission have been writen with the same approach (embarked battery mass corresponds to required battery mass). Inportant remark : to keep consistency with fuelled airplanes, battery mass is book kept above OWE

marilib.aircraft_model.operations.mission_b.b_mission(aircraft, dist_range, tow, altp, mach, disa)[source]¶

Mission computation using breguet equation, fixed L/D and fixed sfc

marilib.aircraft_model.operations.mission_b.b_mission_coupling(aircraft)[source]¶

Mass-Mission coupling This relation is put apart from nominal_mission because GEMS does not manage functions that compute their own input

marilib.aircraft_model.operations.mission_b.b_mission_energy_limited(aircraft, tow, total_enrg, altp, mach, disa)[source]¶

Mission fuel limited (range & payload are output)

marilib.aircraft_model.operations.mission_b.b_mission_payload(aircraft, tow, range, altp, mach, disa)[source]¶

Mission simulation (payload weight is output)

marilib.aircraft_model.operations.mission_b.b_mission_range(aircraft, tow, payload, altp, mach, disa)[source]¶

Mission simulation (range is output)

marilib.aircraft_model.operations.mission_b.b_mission_tow(aircraft, payload, range, altp, mach, disa)[source]¶

Mission simulation (take off weight is output)

marilib.aircraft_model.operations.mission_b.b_specific_air_range(aircraft, altp, mass, mach, disa)[source]¶
marilib.aircraft_model.operations.mission_b.cost_b_mission(aircraft)[source]¶

Compute climb performances

marilib.aircraft_model.operations.mission_b.nominal_b_mission(aircraft)[source]¶

Compute nominal mission with range as input

marilib.aircraft_model.operations.mission_b.payload_range_b_missions(aircraft)[source]¶

Compute Payload - Range diagram corner points
